website_summaries.verdict: A relatively full-featured smart security system. It's expensive, but offers the best camera solution, cloud storage options, and home automation compatibility.
pros: You don't need to pay a monthly fee
you get 7 days of free video storage in the cloud
The video and sound quality are good, and users love the ability to easily reposition cameras using their magnetic mounts
cons: Some users report glitches like clips not always recorded when motion is detected and some WiFi network setup and connection issues
That said, WiFi is quirky and these kinds of problems can and do crop up with most other security systems as well

website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line, well-rounded system with a cloud storage plan that will offer long-term savings.
pros: Very easy to set up and has great wireless connectivity up to 100 ft, so you can place cameras in the most effective spots
Features 2-way audio, rechargeable batteries, and comes with free 7-day cloud storage for five cameras
cons: Motion sensor does not always trigger quickly enough to capture useful video unless the person or object is moving across the field of view
750p video quality is adequate, but not as great

customer_reviews.title: Two years later, this is a bad product
customer_reviews.text: When this works, it is a really great product. The problem is that it only works about 1/3 of the time at this point. This all started about 3 months ago. The cameras constantly get disconnected from the hub despite having the same camera locations the whole times. I have to reset the hub daily. The updates routinely crash the system and support is nonexistent. Live chat never works. The newest app update is horrible. Just installed the new Arlo doorbell which also does not work. Battery life in the cameras is down to 5 days tops. Just a useless product at this point.
customer_reviews.author: JAFA

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it, are not functional
customer_reviews.text: the cameras looks nice and are completely wireless, but the cameras have 5 to 10 seconds delay, when I try to see it live freezing all the times and I have a very good wifi, they are not functional if somebody enter in my house I will notice after 10 seconds. I have a cheap baby camera and works perfect and can see online without delay, image quality very good and it just cost me $35.00. Arlo cameras are not worth it. and one of my cameras came broken.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Arlo products are absolute rubbish
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year not. I wish it was returnable. I have well over $500 invested and it never, every works right. The app is CONSTANTLY telling me my system is offline, yet when I log into the web page it's all just working fine. It takes FOREVER to bring up video streams. The cameras typically start recording movement 3-4 SECONDS after detection. Guess what? You've missed 95% of what you needed to see. They have TERRIBLE support, firmware upgrades are flaky at best and it just keeps getting worse. If you value you sanity AND want a working product... DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Zha93

customer_reviews.title: Does not catch anything!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Arlo since I loved the first generation. We got these to catch footage of the bear that dogs through our trash. However by the time the camer notices motion the bear is gone or you see just his butt. I would return but took too long from purchase to set up. I do not recommend these cameras. Go with Nest. Update: Have to charge the batteries every month or less. 2nd Update: Now have to charge every couple of days. The batteries must be shot. Only lasted 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: hmaec08

customer_reviews.title: Purchased November 2018
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this back in November of 2018. We were so happy with it we bought and additional camera and doorbell. We purchased the protection plan and now the camera image has lines and looks pixel. You can not play the footage. I have reached out to the Warranty and tried contacting the seller and have not received a response. I am still under warranty. I can not believe the camera cost this much only to last under two years!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley CS

customer_reviews.title: Poor support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this system about 4 months ago.. About 2 months in, one camera stopped working.. Contacted Amazon they said to to contact arlo/netgear.. Arlo not easy to contact but after being in hold about 44 mintutes they told me to contact Amazon.. Again Amazon told me to contact net gear.. Tried that argued and argued.. Got nowhere.. So basically cameras are good for 2 months and they will not backup the product.. Not happy but spent $500 for a 2 camera system.. They want 150 for one camera..
customer_reviews.author: Brock

customer_reviews.title: Great system for the price
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic mounts limit the angle you can achieve with these cameras under eaves outside. I had to install a wooden block for mounting to adjust the angle. Also, one of the infrared cameras is not emitting enough light to pick up a clear picture on the drive way. I cannot get audio to work and when there are people outside I'm getting constant alerts and cannot find a way to adjust this. However, the quality of the picture, online app use, and ease of installation is excellent. I needed a wire free system and this was a great deal for the system I received. Not sure about battery life, as it's only been installed about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Trish P.

customer_reviews.title: Almost good
customer_reviews.text: This system was installed indoors in a vacation home. Setup was easy and the cameras worked well initially. From there it was downhill. One battery lasted one (1) week in an empty house. Another camera went completely offline twelve days after installation. Fortunately, the third camera, which is plugged in, is still working. The house is five hours away from where we live so a quick drive up to figure out what's going on isn't practical.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Simple to setup and no added fees
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with these cameras. I needed something for the river home and did not want a monthly Monitoring fee. This was perfect. The 3 pack covered my two doors and also the garage. So was perfect and other then it picking up the stray cat or dog. It works great. And getting the notification immediate is nice. I can also check on the home in live mode at any time. So far a great buy. I also have been impressed with the battery life. About 2 months in and the batteries still 80% full. I think partly bc they only use battery when it senses something. Would use again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So much money, So much Junk
customer_reviews.text: Well, this represents about $500 of long term investment safety money. Of these three camera, 0 will charge. $500 -- the batteries won't charge -- Netgear has no customer service; they don't answer the phone. -- Please, please, please, the only thing other than my various pain and agonies right now are your pain and agonies. If you bought earlier Arlo cameras, stick with them even thought their battery life was short. This more expensive 'Pro 2' model, won't even charge the batteries. EVEN under electricity, they will not function. Netgear has devolved into a cheap Chinese sweatshop with NO quality, and they are happy to <insert picture of a screw> their customers.
customer_reviews.author: God where are you?

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup and great cameras.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cameras to provide alerts and coverage of our driveway, barn and porch. We live in the country and often don’t hear when someone drives up, so the motion sensors are great. The Arlo app is very easy to set up and I like the easy of checking the cameras and alerts, as well as turning off the cameras when we’re outside or working around them. Installation was a breeze, I simply put the cameras together, set up the hub and app and was ready to go. I did purchase sleeves for the cameras because white cameras on a tree or dark wood porch do stand out, but we’re really happy with these cameras.
customer_reviews.author: IT Outsider

customer_reviews.title: Cameras are solid
customer_reviews.text: Cameras work well enough for my purposes, 720p not sharp enough to identify facial features well but they meet my needs, 1080p not worth extra cost to me. App and alerts/settings are user friendly as is setup.motion detection and night vision are solid. Have had issue with one camera being less sensitive but I need to tweak sensitivity settings on that can see if it improves. Overall a solid system. IMO hard wired system is best way to go if you are handy enough for that level of install, but in my case it would be too prohibitive (no where/way to run cables to/from router to certain camera locations.)
customer_reviews.author: JPDIY

customer_reviews.title: Oh boy..
customer_reviews.text: Battery only lasted for 2 weeks. Don’t get me wrong, the picture quality and overall Performance of the camera is outstanding, but the battery only lasting for 2 weeks?! C’mom dude, you can do better than this. Totally useless to run on batteries, unless you’re at home all day and ready to recharge every 2 weeks, go for it, but for property owners who have to rely on these cameras and don’t have the luxury to come back every 2 weeks to recharge (Airbnb), I cant recommend this camera at all
customer_reviews.author: Sarah & Matthias

customer_reviews.title: Good system.. but..
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the Arlo system. The quality is great, the notifications are great. But beware, if you have an active household like mine, you will get nonstop notifications and your battery will likely suffer because of it. I’ve noticed on my iPhone 7 Plus that I have to charge several times a day. Another point is that this system would be good for monitoring an area that doesn’t see a lot of activity. The Arlo batteries only last about 2 weeks before needing recharged (again this is due to high activity). There are tons of recordings it picks up in that span.
customer_reviews.author: Corey W.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve been incredibly impressed with the quality and simplicity of these cameras. The battery life seems quite acceptable considering I live on a busy street, the night vision works very well for the distance that I needed to, and the speeds for streaming are decent enough. I do wish that the response time for motion detection was a little bit quicker but with overlapping fields of view this really is an a problem when using multiple cameras. all told from opening the box to installation and fully functioning and installed cameras took around 30 minutes you really can’t beat that type of ease-of-use.
customer_reviews.author: Jobarda

customer_reviews.title: Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: The Arlo Pro does exactly what I need it to. I got these cameras to be able to check on my daughter while I'm at work. I love the on/off feature. Having that control to turn the camera off when it's not in use makes me feel more secure. Picture is clear enough for what I need it for. If I ever need HD pictures, I will check out the Arlo Pro 2. The only constructive criticism I have would be to design a grid view for live streaming in the app. Most security cameras function that way and I liked that feature from my previous cameras. All in all, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I'd give negative stars if I could.
customer_reviews.text: The system worked for a week. As soon as I left on vacation the system stopped working, right when I needed it most. The app stated that the base station was offline. Upon returning home I confirmed that the cable to my WiFi system was working. The base station is simply faulty. This is totally unacceptable for something that I am relying on for home security. And now after wasting over an hour confirming that the system is faulty, I have to get up on a ladder to take down the cameras, repackage them, then drop them off at UPS. Don't waste your time and money on Arlo.
customer_reviews.author: theDARKmachine

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love the form factor, and physical and video quality of this camera. The included magnetic wall mount is intriguing, but since I don't want to mount them on walls but do want to be able to adjust the angles, I'm machining some free-standing mounts for them. My main (and only, thus far) concern with the camera is that one of the three I purchased has already given me an "incompatible charger" error with an Arlo charger attached! I haven't had time to fully examine the problem yet, but I have read that this is a disappointingly-common problem. So, fingers crossed that this was just a fluke, and the camera will operate properly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Hebrock

customer_reviews.title: If you need security cameras go wired. Arlo provides subpar performance.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well. There are a number of issues with this system. Night vision does not work well at all. Takes a long time to load cam views. Picture quality is not good. Cant even make out faces and much less license plates no matter the distance. You eventually will wire for power like I did. And doing so you will realize.. hmmm should have went with the traditional setup. Entering password or fingerprint when launching from mobile phone is mildly frustrating. Spent a ton of money... not worth the investment. If you are looking for security this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: F. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection doesn't work for any of the cameras for several hours a day and there is no way to manually turn it back on. You have to 1. Determine it decided to take "time off." 2. Wait it out. More time wasted buying junk on Amazon that needs to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great video and audio
customer_reviews.text: Got the pro package so I could watch my destructive dog being out of the kennel for the first time. It works great. Able to see everywhere he goes and what he’s doing and the 2-way audio works great to tell him to lay down. Also able to see when my packages are delivered. Well worth the price, easy to install, pairs well with my older Arlo cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Impressive system
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with the Arlo camera system so far. The cameras themselves are really good: they were pretty easy to setup, good pictures/video, the sound quality is pretty good. Really the only thing I am not very pleased with is the app/software. It has not been as easy to setup an account for my wife as I think it should be. I’ve not tried customer service yet but have read it’s not good; the “community” is, apparently, the biggest part of the support given. I have used the community for a couple of questions which were answered after some searching. Overall I’m pleased and will probably add cameras to my system.
customer_reviews.author: Papaw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent System for certain needs.
customer_reviews.text: This system is very simple to setup. The video is very high quality. Not really a camera that is going to pick up license plates or some serious facial recognition but that is not what I was going for. Wanted more of a perimeter view to see if someone entered the property not specifically to be able to identify them. One needs a much more complex system for that.
customer_reviews.author: Black

customer_reviews.title: Useless for motion detection
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after purchased Arlo removed option for targeted motion detection, so without that my cameras pick up cars passing and record all day. Besides that it takes so long for camera to record after motion is detected the mailman can walk across my lawn 20 feet and drop off mail before it even starts recording. Cameras are essentially useless for motion detection. One of the 3 cameras constantly goes offline and i have to remove and install the camera all over again. Would not buy again, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Netgear ArloPro Camera Failed after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Netgear does not stand behind its ArloPro camera hardware sufficiently for my expectation. I bought a set of 3 security cameras with a base station for $536.47. One camera failed at just over the 1-year mark. The purchase order was August 2017 and the failure was September 2018, so it was beyond the 1-year warranty. So technically, since it is beyond warranty, they have met their obligation. However, this was not an inexpensive purchase so I would expect better quality control. The other two cameras were subject to the same weather conditions and are still working. The low general rating is because of Netgear not standing behind its product.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Arlo Pro. There is no monthly fee for 5 cameras, they record during the motion duration, has 2 way communication, good quality video. I use this for the house perimeter, and backyard. I took a star because it has a delay time. I won’t be comparing this to a professional security company, but as a diy user controlled security camera, this is perfect. I added floodlight to scare away the cats visiting the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: haynakunanay

customer_reviews.title: After update, it quit working--- expensive junk
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing, only 1 of 3 cameras work after their "update" Hours spent trying to reboot/reset.. the website is garbage and confusing. Its 5 months old. WASTE OF MONEY ....******UPDATE***** I have all 3 cameras working again. But for how long?. Adobe Flash will no longer be supported in 2020 and this system uses it. When it works its a good system, but its had some issues. Ill keep the 1 star rating because its so difficult and contacting Arlo is impossible.
customer_reviews.author: tiggershark

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: bought this in january 2019 and it has broken. its ok but not worth the money. video is not that great monthly fee for 24/7 recording. app is very slow. say you get a alert someone is in your garage....by the time you get connected to say something they are gone cause too much lag. my cousin had a outboard motor stolen from his house his alro picked up the motion when the thief was going out of camera view got him walking away with the motor. no face shots though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A few issues...
customer_reviews.text: Update: Watch the delay first hand with my posted video. Then the camera stops recording in the middle of live action!! Terrible camera motion sensors. 3 weeks into installing I regret this purchase! There is a 3 to 4 second delay in recording once the motion sensor is activated. Speaking through the camera at max volume isn't very loud and is choppy. Day 3 with unit hooked up the batteries are already down to 71%, 75%, 78% (not a high traffic area) WiFi signal isn't that strong, 2 of my cameras only have 1 signal bar and occasionally malfunction So I've heard it takes 2 hours to charge each battery, can only charge 1 at a time.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Very intuitive to set up and easy ...
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE 5/28/18***. Just 1 da after I installed unit. The cell (app) and computer (website) disconnected automatically and won't allow me to connect. VERY disappointing! This is supposed to be much better that the no-name Chinese stuff..... I have to call them tomorrow morning. Can't ANYONE build reliable products anymore...ANYONE????? So far (just got it today), I love it! Very intuitive to set up and easy to understand. REAL HD image, unlike the "HD" no-name cameras advertised here. Built in Vietnam, which is great compared to you know where.... The image quality and response time of the motion detection is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: XJfan

customer_reviews.title: Get solar hook ups if the camera angle will be in high traffic
customer_reviews.text: It literally does what is says. The whole offline message you get, all you have to do is close all apps and start the arlo app again, takes less then a minute to do so and boom, live shots again. You do have to recharge quite often if you have the camera in a highly trafficked area. Unless you have the solar hooked up to it then you will he fine. But over all I am content with it and it does give you a piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Anana Venegas

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 cameras to cover the external areas of my house that I felt needed coverage and these have exceeded my expectations. The video and sound is clear and I love how easy it is to adjust the settings. We were able to mount 2/3 cameras to our gutters/drains and mounted our 3rd easily with the mounting bracket provided. Connecting and setup was extremely easy and I'm looking forward to adding more inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Rethink you purchase, battery life is too limited
customer_reviews.text: 40 days of use and batteries require a recharge. Arlo support claims that their batteries can run for months with limited monitoring. So in effect, little to no monitoring will allow for months of use, otherwise expect to haul in the cameras to recharge, TERRIBLE. Arlo support also shared that the cameras should be mounted no more than 7 feet up... what a joke. I lost money on these but rest assured I will never buy another Netgear Arlo product.
customer_reviews.author: Marius

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is only a few days.and won't connect
customer_reviews.text: This purchase has been a great mistake. The battery life is only about a week with all of the settings set to the lowest. And worst, most of the time when we want to see what is going on it continually fails to connect. I called them earlier on the battery life and they suggested changing the settings and should last 6 months. We did that and now constantly have to take them down to charge. It is worthless and can not get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Emerick

customer_reviews.title: After 9 Months not worth the money !!!
customer_reviews.text: On May 19th I purchased the 3 Camera Set of Arlo Pro Cameras. First couple of months they were awesome. Picked up everything. Now they pick up what they want to pick up. My wife leaves in the morning it will pick up her car leaving. Mine sits right next to it and nothing. She gets home it only picks up after she gets out of the car. EXTREMELY DIS-APPOINTED in this product. Suggested it to four of my co-workers and they purchased it right after I did. Now I have nothing but a bunch of crap that works once in a while. Do not waste your money as 8-10 months from now you will have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Get the Pro2, or have lower expectations
customer_reviews.text: I expected this camera to be able to capture finer details of people coming up to my house, or cars passing by, but looking at the picture quality, I cannot imagine getting any useful details if capturing a crook red handed. The camera can't really capture any license plates from 60~80ft away, and it can't really capture faces from 20~30ft away. A real shame because the rest of the concept of the camera is great. There is a significant picture and audio delay though, this is not ideal as well... almost 2 seconds. Makes having a conversation over camera not good... and therefore cannot really be a substitute for a ring doorbell or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: The Lord

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless system available currently
customer_reviews.text: IMO best home wireless camera system but charging becomes laborious.. Especially for any camera out of reach (outside mounted cameras). Camera quality seems to fade in particular lighting. I notice that the quality of the picture is good sometimes and not other times. This is not my connection as I have almost 1000 mbps wireless speeds on high end modem / router equipment. I tried the PRO 2 and decided that this set is actually better. The PRO 2 at its highest video settings just DRAINS that battery. The best quality is medium with these cameras for ample usage and not having to charge daily or every other day/ like PRO 2.
customer_reviews.author: MasterSconi

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Super EZ to set up & mount cameras, came with free basic cloud storage, and alerts arrive super fast on my phone/email. I saw complaints about the motion activation not picking up fast enough but good camera placement with movement mostly across the field of view worked good for me...already added extra cameras. I did camo the mount bracket & ordered silicone camo skins (TAKEN brand) to cover the cameras for my mounting locations.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $!!! Good cameras overall
customer_reviews.text: These are good cameras! Pros: records great, can hear conversations/animals very clear, works off WiFi and picks up surprisingly long distance, hood night vision... Cons: battery life is short when motion detection is active such as at the driveway or animals in back yard, takes too long to pick up on motion detection (by the time someone has driven by, it goes off and all you hear is the persons vehicle) but as long as it’s a continuous motion such as walking or driving slow... it does good keeping up with short interval videos of motion detected! Once WiFi goes out, cameras stop working but as long as you have WiFi... you have cameras! Good over all... would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Tgoad6113

customer_reviews.title: Not happy. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Base station is now off line going on three days. I tried rebooting, etc. next I’ll try to remove and reset the system, which is a pain. And if it doesn’t work, an even bigger waste of time. I’ve had issues in the past with cameras going off line and it usually took an hour or two to resolve. This is much worse. In addition: Motion detection is slow and there is a noticeable lag in recording start time. All in all, I regret this purchase. I am exploring new options - if I have to reinstall this system, better to install a more reliable and robust one than stick with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: TaeJohnDo

customer_reviews.title: Great overall. Best value IMO
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Wireless Easy install. No wires. Set up and Installed in 1h Good instructions Good quality Picture is ok but could be better (this one is 720, the Pro 2 is 1080) $200 discount makes this the best value overall 7 day cloud recording Good app for viewing USB video backup Cons: Picture resolution could be better but I am happy with it especially with the price Battery so you need to charge every few months. I’m ok with that You can’t install the cameras too far from the base
customer_reviews.author: vear

customer_reviews.title: Used and damaged items
customer_reviews.text: I have received an open box item. That is not what I purchased. I ordered a new item but did not receive it. The cameras are scratched and used. See the pictures attached. I usually am happy with purchases I make but I was severely disappointed with this one. I will attach another review once I can test the cameras as long as all of the parts are there
customer_reviews.author: David J. Stolts

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price.  Motion detector too slow to pick up anything.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive camera with poor characteristics. The motion detector is slow to catch vehicles or people. By the time it starts recording, the person or vehicle is out of view with sensitivity at 100%. The camera is only 720p which means you CAN'T read license plate or faces even when they walk under the camera. Setting up the camera was very easy with little to no effort.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: battery life
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying something easy....every week I have to recharge. A Year later, the battery are dying with one day of use. In addition to the hight price, the batteries are too expensive $50.00. What a waste of product and money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and it works
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the complaints about Ring, I decided to go with Arlo even though it wasn't as cost effective for my application. I just put the cameras up today, and wow. Easy to put up, easy to set up and the app is super easy to use. Overall, I'm very impressed. The cameras themselves seem to hit all the required high notes. They record on motion, and so far traffic on the street isn't generating false positives. Sound quality is OK. We tested it out and the audio is there but hard to make out. Very happy with the product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not connecting in real time. Bad camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera becomes a joke. It send me alerts after 5 minutes so that mean if a thief broke in + the time I make a 911 call + time for police arrival, the bad guy already gone. not connecting So many times when I want to check on my house even though my internet is Broadband high speed Comcast. Time delay about 10 second in real time as I stand in front of the camera and check my movements from my phone. The cheap Chinese design and made ip camera is even better compared to this one. So disappointed will never buy arlo again
customer_reviews.author: John tern

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a nest camera at the same time. They both came in today. The pair of nest cameras I got work great. Set them up in 10 minutes, Not counting mountings. The arlo pros, I had to call tech support which took near 2 and a half hours and another 70 dollars just to get a picture. But I can not watch live feed and the playback is near 5 minutes behind. The audio is muffled and blotchy even in the recordings. I will be returning these tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Buy warranty !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well I’ll start out by say I bought this system April 27 2018 (today is July 6th 2018 )Now one of the battles won’t charge at all . Keeps tell me I have to change battery. I’ve only had to charge the batteries 1 time @ 45% ! Why do I have to buy a new battery??? W/warranty so I’m gonna have to call the manufacture . And see if the will replace the bad battery. Other than that I love the system, this is unacceptable ! Not a happy camper rite now .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED! I’ve had this system since 10/2017. What you see on your phone is great. Although the night vision and pictures are clear, that does you no good when the batteries don’t last or the cameras constantly go off line. Have bought new batteries and still was no better than the ones that came with it. Four cameras total, 3 I can no longer get back on line; will no longer sync. The fourth never worked right. I guess now I need to spend more money and hope I don’t run into the same problems
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Great product. A little pricey, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Motion sensor is above average, not amazing as promoted, the camera picture is awesome. Wyze has a better motion sensor even from distance. Sells camera is waaaaay better though and the night vision. I’d highly recommend this product, Arlo is better also because it constantly alerts you to any motion outside or inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great System
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless system out there. Easy set up and great picture/video quality. Purchased a system and Iiked it so much I purchased another system for second house. Great peace of mind being able to pull up cameras anytime and check out status of house. Only issue is that you need a pretty solid internet connection or cameras will not communicate with app properly. Battery life is 2-4 months so not a big deal to recharge a few times per year. Overall I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: B. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not liking wireless system. Battery life is a pain
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt capture events as i thought ut would. It will start recording and before the event is over the camera will stop recording. I've tried multiple settings from lowering/rasing the motion sensor to changing the amount of time it should record. Still misses events. I liked the idea of wireless but between battery life and lack of recording events leaves to not like wireless cameras. Im opting for a hardwired system. Wireless is good for my shed. Captures that great because the shed is about 15ft from the house and running a cable there wouldnt be feacable. Long story short, only use wireless when it is too difficult to run hardwired system due to distance or construction.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Researched a few cameras and decided on this one, mainly due to the reviews. I had the base and all three cameras set up in about twenty minutes. They were easy to mount and have great picture. I like the fact that they are magnetic and can be easily removed for charging. I was also able to customize the camera to turn off the sound and go to a lower picture quality to save battery. It's only been a day but I'm very happy with the ease of set up and quality at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandma's house. For both security and to keep an eye on her. The 3 camera's were installed outside. They are water proof, catch every movement, and the audio is amazing. Sure, you can guy a cheaper camera, but, you wont get the piece of mind or quality of these cameras. I love them! Def a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Dannie

customer_reviews.title: Base stations are junk
customer_reviews.text: I have Arlo camera systems in three homes. Over the past two years I've had to purchase a total of six base stations because the network interfaces don't work or fail. I just unpacked this three-camera system for a new house, plugged in the base station and it was dead. Amazon give you no way to return just one component so it was either pack up all the cameras, mounts, hardware etc. and return, or just spend the money and buy another base station. Cameras are okay, image quality is decent. Motion detection is quirky but generally works. But the product quality of the base stations leaves much to be desired. They are mostly junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the price point of the systems. Being wireless is a great feature and mounting is a snap. Crisp clean video and the microphone is awesome; picking up sound from several hundred feet away! My only complaints are the ability to speak thru the camera doesn't work with my Android device which to me would be the majority of the users choice of device when trying to use this function. (Pretty sure we aren't sitting in our home on a computer with a microphone). The other complaint is alot of times by the time its recording the motion causing it to record is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good DIY camera system.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this system for some DIY home security. Have Nest products and My Fox systems as well for inside. Have 2 cameras mounted outside to view the pool area and driveway. They work well, good image quality and they do pick up motion as something enters their field of view. I get an alert to my phone and can quickly review the video of the motion or open the camera for live view. Battery life has been great, put these out end of the summer and just now at the end of December 2017 one camera needs a battery recharge. The cold weather probably also impacts battery life. Overall very happy with the system and ease of use
customer_reviews.author: M. Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 cameras in the beginning. I ended up buying another. I love the time between charging. It lasts a long time and one of my cameras is by my mailbox near the road, so it gets a lot of traffic. It Notifies me on my phone and my Apple I-watch when someone has passed in front of the camera. I like the fact that it sends me an email notifying me that The battery is running low. The only thing that I wish was better Is the length of time that it stays on and detection. Overall it is one of the best. I have tried others that I have returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup. Durable Feel. Not badly priced
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Arlo Pro with 6 cameras to setup around my house. I purchase the mounts and silicon sleeves as well since I was mounting them outside. So far so good with monitoring and notifications. I researched tons of cameras and settled on the Arlo based on all around price, quality, easy installation (no wires), and no monthly fee for the basic service needs. The monthly fees are quick cheap if upgrading, but the Arlo Base also has storage options to add on USB storage. This is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SirAegis Games

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: The product is a bit difficult to get going. I had a very difficult time getting the geofencing to work. The tech support was substandard. I finally figured it out myself. Picture quality was ok not great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lupone

customer_reviews.title: Good system but horrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this system in August and immediately had issues with the batteries not holding a charge for longer than a week. Made adjustments to the settings since my pets were setting off the motion detection, and it made no difference at all. Now the batteries last only a couple of days before I have to charge them again. Honestly best just to turn them off to conserve the batteries but kinda defeats the purpose, doesn't it????? Otherwise picture quality and everything else is good. The batteries just suck suck suck suck. Biggest waste of money out there.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Reliable home surveillance cameras
customer_reviews.text: Arlo is a very good camera system. We had ours for over a year and are very pleased with it. It stores alarms for the last seven days. It alerts you via email if the sensors is set off by someone or something. Usually it takes 2 seconds to get an email. It has a siren which is fairly loud and the biggest plus of the system is that the cameras are completely wireless. You can move your cameras anywhere in the house which is very convenient. Image quality is good but its only 720p. Overall very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Good but often slow to notice motion.
customer_reviews.text: These are good except they have a lag in detecting motion. The object in motion is often more than 1/2way through the screen by the time the recording begins. The battery life is quite good, image quality is pretty good. Audio is mediocre . Easy to set up and schedule when you want the system to be 'Armed'. Also easy to offload recordings as needed. You don't need a subscription but for $10/month you get more control over the 'hot' spots in the frame, and you get to keep more footage online.
customer_reviews.author: Bru Ha Grafix

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy any more
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of the various Arlo cameras but will no buy any more. I like the cameras but no longer trust NetGear. I had a number of VueZone cameras and NetGear discontinued support. I’m sure that someday when they have a new line of cameras, they will discontinue support of the Arlo line of cameras. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Hadley E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Works good but need a fast internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: The camera set up is simple and straight forward. The fact it's completely wireless is the biggest selling point. Put the cameras wherever you wanna and you're all set. Only downfall is you need a high speed internet connection or you will have a solid 10 second delay before the cameras trigger and start recording. The app/premium service is $10 a month but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The batteries ae a serious PIA
customer_reviews.text: units work well as long as the batteries are charged. Once a battery reaches 0%, it will never charge again. all of my cams are hooked up to the solar panals and the trickle charge from them worked for a while. Now, despite buying extra batteries, and 2 external chargers, I have 2 cameras totally inoperative because no batteries work. Even using the stock charger and cable that comes with the units, the batteries refuse to charge. It worked great for about a year, now it's a pain in the rear.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothrivers

customer_reviews.title: ... wasn't sure if these cameras were going to be good. In a time when 1080p is the standard ...
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure if these cameras were going to be good. In a time when 1080p is the standard and 4k is peaking through, 720p seemed like it was going to...well suck. But these cameras have pleasantly surprised me. They are definitely clear, respond well when they detect motion, and are VERY easy to setup. My gripe with these is that although they are clear, you can't really see someone's face as clearly as you'd like. It doesn't bother me that much, but if that's something critical to you, I'd suggest going with the Arlo Pro 2 cameras instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul Gupta

customer_reviews.title: These cameras are crap!
customer_reviews.text: These are the WORST cameras ever. I gave one star because I had to. Once the camera and or cameras go off it takes about 15-30 seconds to see what is out there, by then they are already gone. They also don’t go off right away. They don’t go off until we have already passed the camera. These are a piece of crap, DON’T buy them!
customer_reviews.author: BabyBlue

customer_reviews.title: This is great to have taking care of elderly!
customer_reviews.text: Mom is 80 and can’t get around so I move in and had to get a video system to check on her while being out to get groceries and stuff believe me it took a lot of stress off me to be able to check the app to look and listen what was going on an make sure she was still ok. Never had security cameras before but I know this one is well worth the price just to have that moment of freedom while being gone.
customer_reviews.author: N.Vincent Hayes air one drone services

customer_reviews.title: Beware Camera Failure Shortly After Warranty Is Up!
customer_reviews.text: I owned this camera set for a little over a year. And much like others have posted, a camera failed for no apparent reason and would no longer sync with the base station. I contacted customer support to find out that the camera is not under warranty any longer and that I am simply out of luck. They'll give you a "sorry" and thats it no offers for reduced pricing or following up with supervisors. I wanted to love this camera system but paying over $600 for a camera setup that only lasts for less than 2 years seems crazy to me.
customer_reviews.author: LadiBap

customer_reviews.title: Batteries die in just 3-7 days rather than 6 months as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Camera is fine, but the Batteries die after 3 days - 1 week. sometimes if we use the app to watch a few videos, the batteries die after about 3 days. It is really annoying to keep taking the cameras off the the wall ( need to keep grabbing a chair because the cameras are high up ) and placing them into the correct positioning again every 3-7 days. The reason we bought it was because it said the batteries would need to be charged Every 4-6 months.
customer_reviews.author: ElisnAlex

customer_reviews.title: BATTERYS DYING AFTER LESS THAN 2 DAYS! ! !
customer_reviews.text: BATTERYS DYING AFTER LESS THAN 2 DAYS! ! ! I’ve put it on “best battery life mode “ turned all extra features that might take more battery including turning the cameras COMPLETELY OFF at night time! Can’t contact customer support through Amazon... maybe after this review I’ll get contact and hopefully update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Oded.p

customer_reviews.title: Burglers, Prowlers, stalkers and Porch Pirates beware the Arlo Pro is your worst nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Ive been looking for a good quality video surveillance system for my home. While Ive not had any problems to date, I don't intend on getting caught with my pants down. The Arlo Pro is a fantastic system, simple to install, simple to add on additional cameras, etc.. I'm still amazed how quickly it catches the action, the night vision is sharp and clear. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Llevoc

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life very short
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave this product a three star rating is because they can’t seem to get the one bug fix needed and that’s battery life. When you first get the cameras they’re great. But 3-4 mos down the road the battery life drains really fast, lasting only a few weeks compared to three months! If you purchase, get the charging cords or extra batteries. The Netgear community boards are filled with frustrated people and bad comments. Beware! This has been going on a long time with no permanent fix!
customer_reviews.author: N Gregory

customer_reviews.title: short battery life
customer_reviews.text: What appealed to me was there isn't a monthly fee to monitor my cameras or store my short videos that my camera took, however, the rechargeable batteries die after about nine months. I haven't checked out other companies batteries to see what the life of them are. Arlo's batteries cost about $50.00 each, and after the first recharge, the life goes down pretty fast to where you have to recharge sooner, then they completely die after about nine months or shorter depending on use.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Davison

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and under supported
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced and under supported. One of the 3 cameras was DOA. Apparently it takes an act of god to get a replacement. I'm giving up and returning the whole package. After spending $500 and receiving a broken product out of the box you would think a company this size would take care of the issue. Not so. Boo Netgear. Boo to their US support that hardly understands english. Don't waste your money. This is going to be standard tech very soon. May as well wait until a better company comes out with a similar product. Yes, I'm bitter!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Marx

customer_reviews.title: Great Cameras
customer_reviews.text: The cameras are great, but have to mindful of how high you install them because there are times motion isn’t picked up when someone walks up but it captures them just they are approaching the door or leaving. Battery last for more than 30-45 days with constant motion in the area Also wish there was a way to disable motion detection when outside working in the yard in view of the motion detection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Bought it with 4 cameras. 3 of the 4 cameras wouldn’t connect and the one that did connect would lose connection whenever I tried to access it from the app or website. I’d have to wait several hours for it to reconnect and try again. I probably got a dud from everything I see but not worth it for me to try for an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Unusable, save your money
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works. Unusuable because the batteries have a 100% fail rate, and you're forced to buy the same batteries that are destined to fail. They will eventually just stop charging. Arlo has not fixed this after like two or three years. Support doesn't exist. Move on to a different brand. Wish I hadn't spent 500 bucks on this trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Simple and brilliant design
customer_reviews.text: No brainer set-up, simply works as advertised. Battery came fully charged. Will look into subscription model later as it has more features. However, I'm giving only 4 stars due to two major flaws in my opinion. 1. Lag - There's 3-4 seconds of lag of when action happens and when we are alerted. 2. Supplied magnetic mounts didn't provide enough downward coverage that was needed in my set-up. I had to buy additional mounts from Amazon to fix the angle/coverage issue. Hope this information helps the next buyer(s).
customer_reviews.author: Amaz0n Customer3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cameras for basic home security
customer_reviews.text: I love these cameras. They provide a full view of what's happening with our home when we're away and while we sleep. The motion detection works great, although there is a slight delay occasionally. Sometimes we'll see the last few steps of someone delivering a package as they walk by the camera instead of their full approach, but for the most part, they capture everything. The picture quality is definitely good, but we will likely upgrade to the higher-definition versions of these cameras eventually. It's tough to make out exact features with this level, but for the price - no other camera was close.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ramedia

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING ARLO
customer_reviews.text: I have four cameras, that keep me up to date with my pets inside the house and what is going on in the front and back of my home!. It's a great feeling to know with the click of a couple of buttons, I know all that's happening at my home, while I am at work. I have tried many other brands of wireless cameras, and NONE of them can compare to ARLO!. SIMPLY PUT, ARLO IS AN A+, no wonder it starts with the letter A!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Guy

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: These cameras are decent for the money. Not great. Battery life is a lot less than expected. There is about a 4 second delay between real time and what you see. This also seems to affect the “trigger” timing also. I get a lot of notifications and check and most just catch the last glimpse as something moves out of the field of view. The speaker on the camera is nearly inaudible and kind of useless because of the long delay. It is simple to use and setup, although I setup activity zones and they updated something and they no longer work. Video quality is not great either. Doesn’t look he on my settings but I’m no expert.
customer_reviews.author: George Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great system so far
customer_reviews.text: I have owned my Arlo system for 3 months now and love it. I ended up adding 1 more camera to the original 3 camera bundle. So far, the 'heavy use' cameras have seen 3 months for battery life before needing to be recharged. I did read someone on here complaining about that length of time for charging and the need to dismount it, etc. Know the product before purchasing. The slight inconvenience of dismounting the cameras and remounting is nothing compared to needing to run video and power cables for a wired system. I enjoy knowing when packages have been dropped off at my house as well as checking in on my dogs throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall Wireless Camera
customer_reviews.text: The camera really has excellent picture. And the battery life of the devices is better than others I have tried. The range is also excellent. I have one camera about 250 feet from the base station and it still has two bars on the Wi-Fi strength. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a wireless battery operated camera system.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you have tons of patience
customer_reviews.text: Currently going through a nightmare with their support group trying to resolve an Arlo Pro / Arlo Solar Panel issue. You can find my detailed review looking at the Solar Panel reviews. You better have patience if you buy this product. I cannot recommend due to the inevitable support calls you'll need to make.
customer_reviews.author: mike gorgolinski

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Pro 3 Pack by NETGEAR
customer_reviews.text: Well I love the system myself. Is it perfect NO! Anything is better than nothing and I already caught someone at my shed at night with the 2 camera system that I had. So I purchase the 3 pack when I seen it on sale browsing Amazon. I can't say anything about the longevity of the system's because I only own the 2 camera system for 9 days but without any major issues. Just hoping the system's will last a long time and that Arlo will keep pushing Firmware updates for a long time as well.
customer_reviews.author: tracker258

customer_reviews.title: I bought 4 of these and they were very easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these and they were very easy to setup, upgrade, and install. The IOS app was a little flaky, but I'm not sure if it's because I had multiple cameras updating at the same time. So far everything is working fine. The magnetic mounts are nice, but I will most likely change them out for screw in type since they are mounted external to the home.
customer_reviews.author: ninja

customer_reviews.title: We love these cameras!
customer_reviews.text: We have really enjoyed these cameras. We had an unwelcome visitor one rainy night when my wife and kids were home alone. Four days later, I was on a ladder installing this system (took about 20 minutes) while my wife did the tech. From the time we took these out of the box it was about 45 minutes until we were 100% up and running. We feel safer and more secure since having this system. Also, we are now getting a lot of great videos of our kids while they’re waiting for the bus. This is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great security camera
customer_reviews.text: I looked for several months to find a true wireless security camera that had a clear picture. This is it! It was easy to mount, the mounts that come with this are sufficient... I went above and beyond to purchase the other mounts that screw in and it was a waste of money. You can view your house or whatever you're monitoring from your phone so you can see what's going on when you're away. My only problem is there is a delay in recording so you will miss some things... hopefully you don't miss something important! Hoping they can fix this issue and possibly pass that along to those of us who have already purchased the system!!!
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price. Good delivery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price. Good delivery. Functions well. I needed to call customer support with a question about setup. The customer support person gave me the answer that I needed in order to set it up as I wanted to set it up. The wireless function worked better than I had expected in my home. It has a tile roof with a stucko exterior. All three (3) cameras perform well with a good wireless signal. I like the battery and video redings that I can get on the website. The USB device that I use for external storage works well.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent option for DIY security
customer_reviews.text: This camera is incredibly easy to use. Easy to mount. Fantastic picture. The app is also very user-friendly. We had the entire system up and running and mounted to our homes exterior in three different places in under two hours. We only regret not doing it sooner! Note: we did choose to purchase the Arlo mounts, also from Amazon, for mounting the cameras outside.
customer_reviews.author: Sled Diva

customer_reviews.title: Good cameras fair price
customer_reviews.text: The night vision on this camera is impeccable! There’s a huge lag of the cameras are being used wirelessly and not near the router. However, I still think it’s a decent camera. My guess is the updated models are better! Seller provided prompt shipping and I felt the price was fair.
customer_reviews.author: Alphonso McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Good system!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this system for more than a year now and can't say enough good things about it. It's super easy to install and set up and is excellent value for money. Very easy to check up on when away on holiday just to reassure yourself that everything is alright.
customer_reviews.author: LadyNeal

customer_reviews.title: Clear picture, highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough great things about this brand! Clear video-we have these all around our home; makes me feel safe. Additionally, I love that the app is very user-friendly and it's very easy to check on things when you're on vacation, out of town, etc. Would definitely buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: SBell

customer_reviews.title: Bad batteries and poor tech support by netgear- avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the 3 batteries were defective, batteries are supposed to last up to 3 months lasted less than 20 days with less than 1-2 movement actions per day. The netgear tech support was poor so I am returning the system.
customer_reviews.author: tl

customer_reviews.title: Real time interaction is slow
customer_reviews.text: I could never interact with a person at the from door in real time...to slow, and audio coming to of camera is very weak. Hypothetically, by the time someone came to the door and stole a package, that would be long gone by the time I got the email notification. I guess good for monitoring and motion history, but not a good real time camera for me.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home security
customer_reviews.text: We did not want to pay a monthly subscription fee for home security. This was the perfect solution! The upfront cost is expensive but considering the fact that there are no monthly fees, it saves you hundreds in the long run. I highly recommend this system. We have had it for about 8 months now and all cameras are still holding up perfectly. We have 2 outside which have stood up well to the Florida weather and one inside which has been perfect for checking on our dogs while we are at work.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: TRASH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arlo cameras are terrible, we got the three pack system last year on June 29, 2019 and come December same year one of them stopped working And now the second one is not working so I’m expecting the third one to stop working soon as well, so they are not worth every penny you spent on them, in other words they are trash, and I don’t even want to try to return them cause I already know they will say that they have no guaranty anymore, so DONT BUY ARLO unless you are rich and don’t care about throwing your money away
customer_reviews.author: Martha Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive home monitoring
customer_reviews.text: This is our first home monitoring device and it's pretty amazing how technology these days can let you spy on your own home from anywhere in the world! Sometimes if my wife's cell phone ringer is off I'll pull up the great room Arlo cam, see if she's there, then call drop in on Alexa to get ahold of her. We bought some brown skins so they are barely noticeable on the wood shelves. Will be great as date-night sitter monitors. The ease of setup is pretty impressive. Currently have a 3-pack of indoor/outdoor Arlos setup in key areas of the house. I'll definitely be expanding our camera setup with baby cams and front patio monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Wade Schlappi

product_meta.title: Arlo Pro - Wireless Home Security Camera System with Siren | Rechargeable, Night vision, Indoor/Outdoor, HD Video, 2-Way Audio, Wall Mount | Cloud Storage Included | 3 camera kit (VMS4330)
product_meta.description: Arlo Pro is a 100% wire-free indoor/outdoor security camera with rechargeable batteries and audio and can be added to any Arlo base station system. Arlo Pro includes rechargeable batteries, motion and sound-activated alerts, 2-way audio, a 100+ decibel siren, and 7 days of free cloud HD video recordings. Arlo covers every angle to help keep you safe and protected. Camera Operating Temperature -20 Degrees Celsius to 45Degrees Celsius and Base Station Operating Temperature 0 Degrees Celsius to 50 Degrees Celsius.

Weather resistant : Arlo Pro cameras are Weather resistant so you can place them anywhere indoors and out
2440 mAh rechargeable battery. Battery life varies based on settings, usage and temperature. High speed Internet connection minimum 1Mbps upstream recommended
2 Way Audio : Built in mic and speaker enable push to talk capability, so you can listen in and talk back
7 Days of Free Cloud Recordings : Arlo Pro comes with rolling 7 day cloud recordings. Live stream or view recorded video and audio for up to 7 days
Works with Amazon Alexa/Echo Show/Fire TV/Google Assistant : View your live video with a simple voice command. Works with IFTTT, Samsung SmartThings, and more

Arlo Smart adds powerful intelligence to your Arlo cameras. Customize alerts to detect people, specific zones, and contact emergency responders right from your smartphone’s lock screen (optional service, includes 1 month trial).Wireless range:300+ feet line of sight
